div.p: Pure restart of the embedded broker is not advisable, since it's state could be corrupted. Therefore, you're advised to instantiate the broker again before restarting it.

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: In 5.3 however, we allowed the force start of the broker that has been stopped for use cases that need this functionality. You can do it by using

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default
brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: However, it's better (more reliable) to instantiate the broker again if it is possible.
